grammar.rule: En inglés la edad usa 'to be', no 'to have'
grammar.exercise: Traduce: Ella tiene 25 años

grammar.wrong: I need to make my homework
grammar.correct: I need to do my homework
grammar.rule: DO = tareas, actividades abstractas. MAKE = crear, producir algo
grammar.exercise: Completa: Can you ___ me a favor?

grammar.wrong: He said me that he was tired
grammar.correct: He told me that he was tired
grammar.rule: TELL + persona. SAY + lo que se dijo (sin persona directa)
grammar.exercise: Completa: She ___ me the truth

grammar.rule: 'People' ya es plural en inglés. No se dice 'peoples' (excepto para pueblos/etnias)
grammar.exercise: Corrige: Many people thinks this is wrong
grammar.answer: Many people think this is wrong

grammar.rule: En inglés siempre necesitas un sujeto. Usa 'it' como sujeto expletivo
grammar.exercise: Corrige: Is raining outside

grammar.rule: 'Agree' es verbo en inglés, no adjetivo. No lleva 'to be'
grammar.exercise: Corrige: She is agree with the plan

grammar.wrong: I've been living here since five years
grammar.correct: I've been living here for five years
grammar.rule: SINCE + momento específico (2020, Monday). FOR + duración (5 years, 3 months)
grammar.exercise: Completa: I've known him ___ 2019

grammar.wrong: Actually I'm working on a project (meaning 'ahora mismo')
grammar.correct: Currently / Right now I'm working on a project
grammar.rule: 'Actually' = en realidad, de hecho. 'Actualmente' = currently, right now
grammar.exercise: Traduce: Actualmente vivo en Lima
grammar.answer: I currently live in Lima / Right now I live in Lima

grammar.rule: 'Sensible' (EN) = sensato, razonable. 'Sensible' (ES) = sensitive
grammar.exercise: Traduce: Es una persona muy sensible
grammar.answer: She is a very sensitive person

grammar.rule: 'Depend ON', no 'depend of'. Las preposiciones no se traducen literalmente
grammar.exercise: Completa: The result depends ___ many factors

grammar.rule: 'Assist' = ayudar. 'Asistir' (ir) = attend
grammar.exercise: Traduce: ¿Asististe a la conferencia?

grammar.wrong: I don't know nothing about it
grammar.correct: I don't know anything about it
grammar.rule: En inglés estándar no se usan dobles negativos. nothing→anything con don't
grammar.exercise: Corrige: She doesn't have no friends here
grammar.answer: She doesn't have any friends here

grammar.rule: AT = hora (at 3pm). ON = día/fecha (on Monday). IN = mes/año/periodo (in January)
grammar.exercise: Completa: The meeting is ___ 10 AM ___ Friday

grammar.rule: MANY + contable plural. MUCH + incontable. A LOT OF = ambos
grammar.exercise: Completa: We don't have ___ time left

grammar.wrong: It looks that it's going to rain
grammar.correct: It looks like it's going to rain
grammar.rule: 'Look like' para parecer. 'Looks that' no existe en inglés
grammar.exercise: Corrige: She looks that she's tired

grammar.rule: Algunos verbos van seguidos de gerundio: enjoy, avoid, consider, finish, suggest
grammar.exercise: Corrige: She avoids to talk about it

grammar.wrong: I remember to meet you last year (meaning 'recuerdo haberte conocido')
grammar.correct: I remember meeting you last year
grammar.rule: Remember + gerund = recordar algo pasado. Remember + to = acordarse de hacer algo futuro
grammar.exercise: Completa: Don't forget ___ (lock) the door

grammar.correct: Can you explain this to me?
grammar.rule: 'Explain something TO someone', no 'explain someone something'
grammar.exercise: Corrige: She explained us the situation
grammar.answer: She explained the situation to us

grammar.wrong: I want to go to home
grammar.rule: 'Home' funciona como adverbio con verbos de movimiento. No lleva 'to'
grammar.exercise: Corrige: Let's go to home early today

grammar.rule: No se usa 'the' con sustantivos abstractos o generales (life, love, music, science)
grammar.exercise: Corrige: The education is very important
